Author: ivankirigin
Content:
A friend just got a job at Yahoo through a friend of a friend on LinkedIn.

Also, I would contact the administrator at the Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University. I'm sure other top CS/Robotics schools are similar, but I know they'll forward the job opportunity to all the students.

Content: I found a wonderful group noun the other day. A Fixie of Hipsters.

Author: queensnake
Content: 'k, 8/10; I'm pretty pleased. I guessed 3 times, got only one 'guess' right. This is better than the usual quiz; there's an old C++ quiz (from ReviewNet) of 1998 or so vintage floating around, used by a recruiting co I dealt with recently, and it sucked //ass//, it has at least one completely wrong answer, and many that are arguable, or which deem correct, the ossified taste of amateurs vintage 1997/98 (sorry for the misplaced rant).

Author: axiom
Title: Any luck with job search engines for hiring?
Content:
We're a startup in Waterloo, Ontario and we're looking to hire computer vision developers. Has anyone had luck with job search engine sites like monster.com and workopolis.com? Any other sources of brains?

By the way, if you're looking for a job and are ridiculously smart, send me an email. We just got series A funding and are still giving out serious stock option plans to new hires. Contact at imridiculouslysmart at gmail dot com. (Yeah I just registered that.)

Author: alfa
Content: So was switchhouse. No one even bothers with physical media any more for music. Books and movies aren't far behind. Games are the only thing I can think of that might work and have some steam left in it.

Author: simianstyle
Content: There are at least 3 Babson based businesses in there, and I know all of the founders personally. Either they forgot to mention their revenues to me, or both businessweek and yahoo are both fluffing things up.
